wikipedia_page.main: Sir (Herbert) James Gunn  (30 June 1893– 30 December 1964) was a Scottish landscape and portrait painter.

response: Somerville's is the one Oxford dining hall where all portraits show women. They were painted by Michael Noakes, Herbert James Gunn, George Percy Jacomb-Hood, William Coldstream, John Whittall, Francis Helps, Claude Rogers, Humphrey Ocean, Thomas Leveritt and Richard Twose.
*Herbert James Gunn (1893–1964), Scottish landscape and portrait painter

link_mentions.page: Arthur Lee, 1st Viscount Lee of Fareham
response: His widow, Viscountess Lee, presented to the Royal Military College of Canada Museum a silver-headed walking stick of her late husband, which he had used daily at RMC fifty-four years earlier. The stick has two silver bands listing the places where Lee served, or visited, between 1888 and 1904, which include the Royal Military College of Canada. Lady Lee also presented the RMC Museum with three photographs of Lord Lee –- two of them taken in Kingston, one in uniform in 1893, and the other in 1896 wearing a checked suit, silver-topped stick in hand. The third is a photograph of the portrait by Herbert James Gunn in full regalia of a Knight Grand Cross of the Most Honourable Order of the Bath.Lord Lee of Fareham Professor of Strategy and Tactics, R.M.C., 1893-98
His portrait (as Lord Provost of Edinburgh), by Herbert James Gunn is held by the City of Edinburgh Council.

The baronetcy and estate were inherited by his son, Sir John Whitmore (racing driver). He is commemorated in the name of a local pub, The Whitmore Arms. His portrait from W.W.1 hangs in the headquarters of the 70th (Essex Yeomanry) Signal Squadron. A later portrait in Lord Lieutenant's uniform by Herbert James Gunn hangs in the Shire Hall in Chelmsford - see Sir Francis Whitmore. On 10 September 2015, a Thurrock Heritage plaque was unveiled commemorating Sir Francis and other Officers and Men of the Essex Yeomanry and 10th Royal Hussars who served in the Great War.Thurrock Local History Society web site

link_mentions.page: List of painters by name beginning with "G"

response: The artist Herbert James Gunn created a portrait of Harrison in 1964.BBC - Cecil Stanley Harrison, CMG, OBE, Bailiff of Jersey (1962) The painting is located in Jersey's Royal Court.
His portrait by Herbert James Gunn is held by Dumfries Museum.
His portrait by Herbert James Gunn  hangs in Aberdeen University.

More contemporary members of this line include George and William Grindlay, the 18th and 19th century leather magnates and landowners of the former Orchardfield Estate in Edinburgh, Thomas Grindlay, master of Trinity House of Leith, Walter Grindlay, the Edinburgh and Liverpool shipping grandee, and father of Lady Janet Grindlay Simpson, (see Simpson Baronets of Strathavon and Edinburgh), Captain Edward 'Teddy' Grindlay, of the 4th and 10th Scottish Rifles, close friend and patron of Sir Herbert James Gunn, and The Right Honourable Lord Grindley of Rannoch.
